label: clinical_signal_03_ep_023
content:

### Adverse Events
- AE ID: AE-0089, Description: dizziness, Grade: 1, Relatedness: possibly related, Resolved: true, Subject Group: non_statin
- AE ID: AE-0090, Description: nausea, Grade: 1, Relatedness: possibly related, Resolved: true, Subject Group: statin
- AE ID: AE-0091, Description: insomnia, Grade: 1, Relatedness: unlikely related, Resolved: true, Subject Group: statin
- AE ID: AE-0092, Description: hepatocellular injury, Grade: 3, Relatedness: probably related, Resolved: false, Subject Group: statin
- AE ID: AE-0093, Description: jaundice, Grade: 2, Relatedness: probably related, Resolved: false, Subject Group: statin
- AE ID: AE-0094, Description: drug-induced liver injury, Grade: 3, Relatedness: definitely related, Resolved: true, Subject Group: statin

- Statin Count: 55

### Protocol Deviations
- PD ID: PD-047, Description: Missed visit window (2 days late), Severity: minor, Site: site_11

### Investigator Notes
- Training log updated for new study coordinator
- Lab kits inventory adequate for next 4 weeks
- No new safety signals identified this week by local PI
- PK sub-study interim: LNS-4821 plasma concentration data consistent with CYP3A4 inhibition; atorvastatin AUC 3.2x in co-administered subjects

### Events
- CRO quarterly oversight report submitted
- Drug accountability audit at Site 04: no discrepancies
- PK sub-study interim data package distributed to DSMB members

### Notes
- Week 23: PK data supports CYP3A4 inhibition mechanism. Statin subgroup ALT 3-4x ULN.
